query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

category.title: antibiotics
category.displayCode: /medical and health sciences/basic medicine/pharmacology and pharmacy/pharmaceutical drugs/antibiotics

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Widening participation and spreading excellence

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Twinning Bottom-Up

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Standardised Smart EPC contract and tender docs
result.description: D32 REGEA R PU M18243036Standardised EPC contract and tender documentation will contain contract structure necessary general and specific stipulations in the EPC contract stipulations which are especially relevant for Smart City aspects and ICT technology as well as for refinancing of EPC technical requirements in form of output specifications as well as related payment mechanism which is relevant for the growing offer and uptake of services especially those that have potential to generate revenue The contract and tender will be developed in English regularly updated based on the received feedback customized and translated into the national languages of the pilots where relevant The documentation will be regularly updated in Months 18 24 30 and 36

result.title: ICT SMART EPC concept draft
result.description: Smart EPC concept will contain technology output specification based on the knowhow of knowledge partners literature review and specific national examples It will be adapted to include value proposition implementation mechanisms cost of energy and nonenergy technologyservices and possible revenue streams as well as specific pilot requirementsThe report will be regularly updated in M12 M18 M24 and finally in M36

result.title: ICT technology and market assessment report
result.description: Results of the literature review and handson expert experience will be presented in a crosscountry and transdisciplinary comparison together with the case studies SWOT analysis and lessons learned from the results of the qualitative data collection The report will elaborate on the different perspectives of stakeholders and targeted markets The report will also include conclusions on the needs and suggestions for the scope of the ICT technology or possible additional revenue streams from energy and nonenergy related services The report will be regularly updated in M9 M18 M24 and finally in M36

result.title: SHAREs Gateway|implementation toolkit in blueprint version (English)
result.description: The toolkit consists of modules that include information on various topics related to the support of informed decision and energy communities. The first English version in the blueprint will be made available in month 15.

result.title: SHAREs Gateway|communication campaign in blueprint version (English)
result.description: The communication campaign consists of the SHAREs catalogue of communication and engagement methods and white-label material.The catalogue is designed to address the different target groups and provide fitting arguments, framing, language, events, etc. It also provides a clear overview of the costs and benefits of different strategies, estimated impacts, optimal timing, possible support networks and so on.White-label material includes materials, such as text blocks, royalty free pictures, royalty free visualisations, white-label flyers, white-label presentations, webinars, journalist packages, event materials, etc.
